channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hacking Hits the 2024 Race, and a Pivotal Week for Gaza
item.description: Plus, a cheery au revoir to the Paris Olympics.

item.title: How Close Are the Planet’s Climate Tipping Points?
item.description: Earth’s warming could trigger sweeping changes in the natural world that would be hard, if not impossible, to reverse.

item.title: Hurricane Debby remnants leave thousands of businesses and homes without power in the Northeast
item.description: After hitting Florida as a hurricane Aug. 5, the storm spent nearly a week unleashing tornadoes and flooding, damaging homes and taking lives along the East Coast.

item.title: Harris Appeals to Tech Leaders in a Return to San Francisco
item.description: A Sunday fund-raiser offered Vice President Kamala Harris a chance to turn the page on a sometimes frosty relationship between President Biden and Silicon Valley.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel on Guard for Retaliation as Diplomats Push for End to War
item.description: The U.S. and Arab mediators were preparing to present a “final” proposal for a cease-fire in Gaza, as Israel remained on alert for a response to the killings of two militant leaders.

item.title: Americans are refusing to keep paying high prices and that may be killing the U.S. inflation spike
item.description: Some of America's largest companies, from Amazon to Disney to Yum Brands, say customers are seeking cheaper alternative products, searching for bargains or just avoiding items they deem too expensive.

item.title: The Harris-Walz Ticket Is Our Opportunity for Political Imagination
item.description: The candidates are creating space for our most extravagant imaginings.

item.title: U.K. Riots Pose Critical Test for Keir Starmer
item.description: Even after restoring order, the new prime minister faces a bigger challenge: defusing the issues of fraying public services and a cost of living crisis that underlie the unrest.

item.title: Paris Olympic dream struck a chord across France. Now Macron faces a fraught return to reality
item.description: While the Games have lifted what was a morose mood in France, it is far from certain this will give a new impulse to the remaining three years of the unpopular president's mandate.

item.title: U.K. Riots Pose Critical Test for Keir Starmer
item.description: Even after restoring order, the new prime minister faces a bigger challenge: defusing the issues of fraying public services and a cost of living crisis that underlie the unrest.

item.title: A Nazi Villa So Tainted Berlin Can’t Give It Away
item.description: The former estate of Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi propaganda minister, is too expensive to keep and perilous to sell. No one knows quite what to do with it.

item.title: Foreign investors pulled a record $15 billion out of China last quarter
item.description: The slowdown in the economy and rising geopolitical tensions has led some companies to reduce their exposure.

item.title: Harris Should Take Divisions Over Gaza Seriously
item.description: It’s not just a few hecklers. Michigan voters’ concerns about Gaza cannot be dismissed.

item.title: U.S. Orders Submarine to Middle East Amid Fears of Escalation
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III spoke with his Israeli counterpart, Yoav Gallant, the Pentagon said. In an unusual disclosure, it said Mr. Austin had ordered a submarine to the Middle East.

item.title: American tourists are flocking to boardwalks and piers to stick to their summer budgets
item.description: While the affluent are spending freely, lower-income vacationers are sticking to carefully planned-out budgets.
